sub_topic: Determining the surface area of a cone.
message_1: A cone has a radius of 7 cm and a slant height of 12 cm. What is its surface area, rounded to the nearest hundredth?
message_2:
To find the surface area of a cone, we use the formula:

Surface Area = πr(r + l)

where r is the radius and l is the slant height.

In this case, r = 7 cm and l = 12 cm.

Surface Area = π(7)(7 + 12)
Surface Area = π(7)(19)
Surface Area ≈ 3.14 × 7 × 19
Surface Area ≈ 419.46 cm²

So, the surface area of the cone is approximately 419.46 cm², rounded to the nearest hundredth.
